title: Localization does not work in Qute message bundles
body:
### Describe the bug

I have written I type-safe Message Bundles `MyMessages` with namespace `testMsg` and two messages `header` (default "Label") and `greeting` (default "Hello").  
I have written a `messages/testMsg_it.properties` file for localize the messages: `header` is "Etichetta" e `greeting` is "Ciao".  
I have used the `header` message in a Qute template using the sintax `{testMsg:header()}`.  
I have used the `greeting` message in Java using the injection of the `MyMessages` interface.  
Finally I have tested my Web App using my browser configured for Italian language.

### Expected behavior

Message `header` must be resolved to "Etichetta"
Message `greeting` must be resolved to "Ciao"

### Actual behavior

Message `header` is resolved to "Etichetta" (localization OK)
Message `greeting` is resolve to "Hello" (localization KO)

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: [quarkustest.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/11625693/quarkustest.zip)

Try the page `localhost:8080/test`.  
The method handler also logs the `Accept-Language` header.


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

MAC OSX 13.4 x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

17.0.6
